title: Office Manager
description:
**Essential Function**

The Office Manager assists the Corps and Childcare Center in daily activities including payment processing,

Child & Family Resources, purchases, accounting, vouchers, social programs, and answering the

phone. The Office Manager is the first point of contact with visitors & parents and works to support the Corps

and childcare events as needed.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

The duties listed below are the primary duties of this position but are not all the duties that may be required. The Salvation Army reserves the right to change, reduce or expand the duties of this position at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made for individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this role.

Specifically, the primary duties are:

**Office Management**

* Manage all correspondence (voice, fax, mail).
* Maintain accurate Corps records (paper and electronic files; current and archived).
* Coordinate Corps Calendar in conjunction with the Childcare Center & Social Services.
* Cover front office as first point of contact with visitors, clients, and parents of Childcare Center students.
* Keep the front office neat and organized.
* Create and maintain inventory of office products; prepare requisitions as needed.
* Create and maintain inventory of cleaning supplies and paper products for Corps and Childcare Center.
* Coordinate and schedule building maintenance appointments as needed.
* Answer the phones as needed.
* See that the mail is picked up daily and distributed properly.
* Maintain all correspondence with local and regional vendors and inform Corps Officers of needed repairs and costs involved with their upkeep.

**Finance/Accounting**

* Provide oversight to all financial operations of the Corps and Childcare Center.
* Secure and manage the petty cash fund.
* Analyze financial reports and statements as necessary.
* Make weekly reports to the CO pertaining to critical financial matters and status.
* Watch budget, analyze trends and suggest control measures.
* Manage payments through the Child & Family Resources daily in conjunction with the Childcare Director. Produce monthly reports.
* Keep accurate accounting practices consistent with The Salvation Army Standards for Accounting.
* File all financial documentation as back up to SharePoint for audit purposes.
* Reconciliation
* Enter all ARs, APs and Gifts-in-Kind into SharePoint in a timely manner and coordinate with Regional Bookkeeping and Account Manager
* Assist with Red Kettle Campaign entries into SharePoint.

**Human Resources**

* Manage and maintain personnel records for all staff and maintain confidentiality.
* Keep updated records on all personnel and their needs for certifications.
* Process employment paperwork for staff as needed in collaboration with DHQ HR.
* Assist with the UKG payroll system in collaboration with DHQ Payroll Manager.
* Gather, with the help of the Daycare Director, and Social Services, and the Corps Officers all statistics and enter into the DHQ system monthly.
* Work with all employees to create and maintain a safe and healthy work environment.

**Miscellaneous**

* Give weekly and special assignments to janitorial staff.
* Work with Corps Officer(s) and other program leaders to plan and prepare for regular and special programs.
* Collaborate in areas of planning, programming, and presentations of the Corps as assigned by the Corps Officer(s).
* Attend weekly staff meetings.
* Assist the Daycare Director with maintaining the School District Attendance System, providing reports as needed.
* Assist in developing fire drills and emergency lockdown drills.
* Uphold the standards and principles of The Salvation Army mission and ministry.
* Other duties as assigned by the CO that fall within the scope of this position.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in business or related field preferred.
* 1 – 2 years of office management or relevant experience.
* Strong attention to detail, good management, and organizational skills.
* Experience working with financial software preferred.
* Ability to relate professionally with colleagues and the public.
* Proficiency with software/computers required, specifically Word, Excel, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, and internet research.
* Valid NJ Driver’s License and clean driving record.
* Bilingual Spanish/English or Arabic/English preferred.
* Must understand and support the mission of The Salvation Army.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Child Care Inspector: Family Child Care Programs
description:
Norwescap Child and Family Resources (CFRS) is seeking a Provider Specialist. Norwescap CFRS is the designated Child Care Resource and Referral Agency for Hunterdon, Sussex and Warren Counties, by the NJ Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development (DFD). Our mission is to empower families and the community through enhancing the quality and accessibility of early education and by providing information and resources to community services.

The Provider Specialist is responsible for ensuring effective operations in all aspects of the Family Child Care (FCC) registration program and the Family, Friend and Neighbor (FFN) program as defined by the contract with Department of Health, Division of Family Development and Office of Licensing, and Norwescap policies and procedures. This includes supporting potential providers from intake to application, training, inspection, and reporting, as well as other duties assigned by the Provider Manager or other management team.

* Maintain all records for Family Child Care (FCC) and Family Friend and Neighbor (FFN) providers
* Ensure that each FCC provider operates in full compliance with all applicable requirements of the Manual of Requirements and DFD regulations
* Ensure that each FFN provider operates in full compliance with DFD regulations
* Conduct Outreach to attract potential FCC providers.
* Facilitate monthly orientations for potential FCC and FFN providers. Develop and present Peer Group and other professional development/training to FCC providers.
* Provide Technical Assistance to help Potential Providers through the application process and throughout their registration period.
* Utilize systems including NJCCIS and Expedite, schedule, and conduct timely home inspections for new or renewing providers, as well as yearly monitor inspections.
* Receive, process, and follow through on FCC complaints.
* Communicate with the provider Program Manager regularly to share information to enhance tasks and team functions.
* Facilitate providers’ understanding of the EPPIC program.
* Track providers’ CPR/1st Aid expirations and background checks
* Complete program reports
* Attend State and local meetings as required
* Utilize effective communication and active listening in a communication mode that best meets the needs of customers.
* Adhere to strict confidentiality procedures
* Utilize the assessment process to ascertain needs of families and provide appropriate resources and referrals
* Adhere to the Agency’s Personnel Policies and Procedures.
* Performs other related duties as required by the CFRS Director.
* Collaborate with Child, Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) staff to facilitate site visits to ensure compliance with CACFP program and provide technical assistance to enhance program.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Benefits:

* 403(b)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Early Childhood General Education Teachers: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Floater Teacher
description:
**If you want to take part in shaping the future, creating an environment to thrive, and fulfilling life purpose, then this is the place for you!**

**What it's like working at Orchard:** Working at Orchard School means being part of a community. You become a teacher who is deeply invested in your students’ success, and, likewise, you are in an environment of educators who are deeply invested in you. Since the Orchard School is family-owned and operated, it has an atmosphere of intimacy that allows students and teachers to grow in an environment where they’re cared about and understood.

Teachers and administrators work side-by-side to ensure the health, safety, wellbeing, and learning of our students and their futures; after all, working in Early Childhood Education means your hands are directly involved in helping to shape the future. The Orchard School takes this endeavor very seriously, and so seeks team members who want to be active participants in making a change in the world. The Orchard School is a place full of growth.

Our students are growing, our teachers are growing, and even our school itself is growing as we discover and nurture the kind of environment that we can be proud of. At the end of the day, we are looking for teachers who are excited to grow with us to help us be a powerful force in the lives of our students and their families.

**As a Floater Teacher, you will:**

* **Nurture and Support:** Provide primary and secondary caregiving across various age groups, including infants, toddlers, and older toddlers, fostering a secure and nurturing environment for all children.
* **Engage in Play and Development:** Actively participate in play, dance, and developmental activities, supporting Lead Teachers in guiding each child's growth and learning.
* **Prepare and Serve Meals:** Oversee the preparation and serving of morning snacks, lunch, and afternoon snacks, ensuring that all children receive nutritious and balanced meals.
* **Facilitate Nap Time:** Assist children in transitioning to nap time, creating a calm and soothing atmosphere that promotes restful sleep.
* **Support Classroom Activities:** Contribute to classroom activities and child-led play, enhancing the learning experience and fostering creativity.
* **Coordinate Arts & Crafts:** Prepare and organize pre-established arts and crafts activities throughout the week, ensuring materials are ready and accessible.
* **Maintain Hygiene and Schedules:** Support and adhere to potty training and diaper changing routines, ensuring each child's health and comfort.
* **Uphold Center Cleanliness:** Assist in maintaining the cleanliness and upkeep of the center, including tasks such as laundry, dishes, sanitation, and restocking supplies.
* **Build Parent Relationships:** Establish strong, positive relationships with parents through clear and consistent communication, keeping them informed of their child's progress.
* **Ensure Compliance:** Adhere to all regulations and guidelines for children's care, health, and safety, maintaining a safe and compliant environment.
* **Foster a Collaborative Environment:** Contribute to a positive and engaging work environment through collaboration with colleagues and continuous learning.

**Benefits:**

* No weekends
* $300 Sign-On Bonus
* Employee Discount
* Professional Development Assistance
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Childcare Discounts
* Paid Training for CPR, First Aid, and CDA

**Skills, Abilities, and Experience we are looking for:**

* Experience in early childcare
* Organization, time management, and multi-tasking skills
* Oral and written communication skills

**Why work for The Orchard School?**

When you join The Orchard School, you're not just becoming part of a team – you're immersing yourself in a dynamic community that evolves daily, constantly reaching for higher levels dedicated to the success of children.

As leaders in early childhood education and integral co-creators of our teaching team, you personify the core values of The Orchard School. To foster an environment that is not only joyful and dynamic but also relaxed, welcoming, and creatively inspiring, allowing our children to express themselves and engage with their surroundings in unique ways, your presence brings stability to the lives of infants, toddlers, preschoolers, and pre-k children.

A mentality characterized by flexibility, presence, excitement, patience, dedication, and a collaborative spirit cultivates our team of educators. We are deeply committed to excellence and thrive through working together.

Beyond being a Preschool, The Orchard School allows teachers to inspire young minds through our innovative early childhood education curriculum. Our passionate teachers are excited to educate, adore children, and infuse joy into learning.

Whether it's dressing up for holidays or being the silliest teacher in the world, we create an atmosphere where learning is not just encouraged but celebrated. Join The Orchard School, where every day brings new opportunities to inspire and make a lasting impact on young hearts and minds.

Sounds like you, apply now!

**Schedule:**

* 8 hour shift, and additional unpaid 1hr-Break
* Monday to Friday

title: Ceded Re Placements Analyst - US
description:
This is your opportunity to join AXIS Capital – a trusted global provider of specialty lines insurance and reinsurance. We stand apart for our outstanding client service, intelligent risk taking and superior risk adjusted returns for our shareholders. We also proudly maintain an entrepreneurial, disciplined and ethical corporate culture. As a member of AXIS, you join a team that is among the best in the industry.
At AXIS, we believe that we are only as strong as our people. We strive to create an inclusive and welcoming culture where employees of all backgrounds and from all walks of life feel comfortable and empowered to be themselves. This means that we bring our whole selves to work.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion or creed, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, age, marital status, civil union status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Accommodation is available upon request for candidates taking part in the selection process.
How does this role contribute to our collective success?  

AXIS Capital is a well-known underwriting organization and a respected reinsurance buyer. This role is an opportunity to grow knowledge of reinsurance and apply critical skills of written and oral communication, project management, and networking.  

In this role, the Risk Analyst actively engages with internal and external contacts to support treaty placement, administration, and governance. The individual will regularly handle day to day needs of treaty placements, supporting the best execution of all phases of treaty placement process in accordance with company standards and compliance protocols and support special projects as assigned.  

Primarily supporting the UK Senior Placements Lead and Treaty Manager as well as working collaboratively with other Ceded Re colleagues in US with placements and projects as assigned.  

What will you do in this role?* Collating and supporting finalization of reinsurance submissions
* Prepare and review decks for internal and external presentations.
* Prepare schematics and treaty register post placement
* Prepare standard analyses of statistical data using professional knowledge and excel workbook skills
* Coordinate with internal resources in business units and Ceded Re to prepare responses to questions from internal stakeholders and external counterparties
* Communicate with external business partners, brokers, and reinsurers as directed
* Coordinate with internal and external resources to plan and support meetings and reinsurer audits
* Execute appropriate compliance controls as needed with reinsurer audits, work with internal and external parties to resolve any technical issues that arise.
* Assist with Reinsurance Security Analysis which involves confirming reinsurer approval status and preparing referrals to internal reinsurance security review committee as required
* Support internal business controls compliance by maintaining appropriate documentation (including but not limited to maintaining share drive up to date, complete placement checklist, NDAs finalized, maintaining contract logs etc)
* Participates on special projects as required
* Ensure contract certainty through review of contract language and timely delivery of signed contracts
  

You may also be required to take on additional duties, responsibilities and activities appropriate to the nature of this role.  

About You:
We encourage you to bring your own experience and expertise to the table, so while there are some qualifications and experiences, we need you to have, we are open to discussing how your individual knowledge might lend itself to fulfilling this role and help us achieve our goals.  

What you need to have:* Strong Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, PowerPoint, Word, Excel)
* Knowledge of general insurance and reinsurance
* Strong communication skills (verbal and written) with multiple stakeholders, internal and external.
* Ability to analyse data and present results in a clear and concise manner as appropriate to the audience
* Strong independent, organisational and time-management skills, with a keen attention to detail and problem-solving mindset.
* Intellectual curiosity and interest to follow (re)insurance industry themes and emerging risks to support their own professional development
  

What we prefer you to have:* Achieved or working towards Are, CPCU
* Reinsurance related experience
  

Role Factors:  

In this role, you will typically be required to:* Be in the office 2-3 days per week
* May require domestic travel
  

What we offer:  

For this position, we currently expect to offer a base salary in the range of $86,000 - $100,000 (NY). Your salary offer will be based on an assessment of a variety of factors including your specific experience and work location.
In addition, you will be offered competitive target incentive compensation, with awards based on overall corporate and individual performance. On top of this, you will be eligible for a comprehensive and competitive benefits package which includes medical plans for you and your family, health and wellness programs, retirement plans, tuition reimbursement, paid vacation, and much more.
Where this role is based in the United States of America, this role is Exempt for FLSA purposes.

title: RBT (Registered Behavior Technician)
description:
**Job description**

About Gold Heart ABA:

Gold HeartABA is a leading provider of applied behaviour analysis (ABA) therapy, committed to making a positive impact on the lives of individuals with autism. We are seeking dedicated and compassionate ABA Therapists (RBTs) to join our team. In this role, you will work under the supervision of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) to use prompting and positive reinforcement to help individuals with autism develop essential skills for independence.

Key Responsibilities

* Provide applied behavior analysis (ABA) interventions to clients in natural environments.
* Collect, analyze, and prepare data for presentation.
* Coordinate with other program staff to ensure program consistency.
* Provide feedback to parents and guardians regarding the daily activities of clients.

Requirements

* Must be at least 18 years of age.
* High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor's degree in psychology, education, or related field is a plus.
* Previous experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities or behavioral disorders is a plus.
* Knowledge of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) principles and techniques is a Must.
* Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to work effectively as part of a team.
* Ability to maintain confidentiality and professionalism.
* Must be able to pass a criminal background check.
* Must have reliable transportation to travel to clients' homes or other clinic locations, based on client caseload.

Benefits

* Competitive salary:
* Flexible schedule.
* Paid time off.
* Professional development assistance.

Why Join Us?

At Gold Heart ABA, we offer competitive compensation packages, opportunities for advancement, and a supportive work environment. If you are passionate about helping individuals with special needs and are looking for a rewarding career, we encourage you to apply to join our team as a Behavior Technician.

Application Process

If you are passionate about making a difference in the lives of individuals with autism and have the necessary skills and experience, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join our team and help us create positive change in the lives of our clients and their families.

MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE AS AN RBT

title: Quality Inspector
description:
JOB SUMMARY

Under general supervision, the Quality Inspector position requires the mechanical ability to perform first piece and sample inspection. Using standard inspection equipment, solves standard inspection problems and lays out of complicated parts, casting, and assemblies. Makes decisions concerning minor inspection problems, using complicated blueprints and specifications.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

* Read and Comprehend complicated blueprints, sketches, written and/or verbal specifications.
* Proficient in the use of mechanical inspection equipment; including micrometers, gages, go/no gages, optical comparator, CMM and other inspection measuring tools.
* Accurately document the results of the inspections and other data.
* May be Level I Operator or Level II Inspector in one or more liquid penetrant, ulta-sonic or eddy currents.
* Under direct supervision, may assist in the calibrating of gauges.
* Moves parts and materials to and from work area.
* Must pass required eye tests, and will be subject to the random drug and alcohol testing program.
* Follow company policies (Safety, Attendance, etc.), and maintains a clean well-organized work area.
* Can easily accept direction and complete tasks in a timely manner with minimal supervision.
* Inspectors may also be assigned additional tasks or projects as required by management.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

* Requires a high school diploma or equivalent, advanced technical education preferred.
* Inspection experience and working knowledge of measurement instruments required.
* Aerospace and or Nuclear industry experience beneficial.
* Good written/verbal communication skills and Inter-acts with organizational team members and other departments in a professional manner.
* Advanced mechanical aptitude desired.
* Good arithmetic skills are required and experience with the use of standard shop math, limited trigonometry, and a full knowledge of machine shop and assembly operations is beneficial.

EQUIPIMENT/MACHINERY USED

* Basic and advanced inspection tooling.
* Computer Hardware and Software.

**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS**

Lifting up to 25lbs regularly and 50lbs occasionally, pushing, pulling, standing for long periods of time, manual dexterity, visual acuity, and typing.

Work Remotely

* No

We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability.

title: Executive Director
description:
**To be considered for this position, please upload your resume and cover letter at the prompt.**

The New Jersey Chapter of the National Association of Social Workers (NASW), with a statewide membership of over 6,400 (NJ) is seeking a Full-time Executive Director to manage the chapter with demonstrated leadership and management skills. In addition, applicants should have a substantial knowledge of and a strong commitment to the social work profession and social work values, with an awareness of the diversity of social work practice. Applicants should also be able to engage, inspire, and mobilize the Association’s membership. The Chapter Executive Director reports to the NASW Vice President of Chapter Operations at the National Office and works collaboratively with the New Jersey Chapter Boards of Directors.

**Position requires:**

* Senior leadership experience working with professional or non-profit organizations and their volunteer Boards in a professional office environment
* Minimum of 5 years of executive level experience.
* Four-year college degree required; MSW preferred
* Exceptional executive management skills, including the ability to provide oversight for organizational and leadership development priorities, and staff supervision
* Demonstrated budget and financial management skills
* Solid continuing education program planning and implementation skills
* Experience with organizing, conducting in-person, virtual, or hybrid meetings
* Experience in diversity, equity and inclusion practices and strategies
* Strong public policy experience and skills
* Strong advocacy and legislative experience and skills
* Experience in membership services
* Community organizing experience
* Exceptional written and oral communications skills
* Experience working with traditional and social media in professional settings
* Commitment to providing excellent membership support and engagement
* Proficient with Office products software, including Word, Excel and PowerPoint, as well as working in a virtual environment

***The chapter operates out of offices in Bridgewater, NJ and will soon move to a new location in.***

NASW offers reasonable accommodation during the application process for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance during the application or interview process and in completing new hire paperwork to accommodate a disability, please email Monique Thomason at mthomason.nasw@socialworkers.org for accommodation requests.

**This position is eligible for our benefits package, which includes: 401(k) retirement plan, Health Insurance, Paid Time Off, Paid Parental Leave, Health Savings Account and more.**

title: Deburrer
description:
Under general supervision working from blueprints, sketches, verbal and/or written specifications, operates and adjusts manual or numerically controlled machine tools to perform standard and repetitive sequence of operations.

**Additional job duties are as follows:**

Sets up manual machines where speeds, feeds and sequences of tooling operations are ordinarily prescribed.

* Operates numerically controlled machines where programs are approved and setups are made and maintained by others.
* Removes burrs and rough edges from machine component parts using a variety of hand operations, such as; filing, deburring and performing polishing operations.
* Removes scratches, burrs and tool marks from parts, using microscope or magnifier.
* Uses standard shop measuring devices.
* Sharpens drill tools on grinding wheel as necessary.
* Operates automatic welding equipment.
* Moves parts and materials to and from work area.
* Maintains good housekeeping in work area.
* Perform other duties as directed by supervision.

Requires minimum of four years’ experience as a general machine shop operator with demonstrated acceptable performance on both the required machine and manual operations.

title: Medical Registration Receptionist
description:
**Job Summary:**

Upper West Side Endoscopy is seeking a full-time Registration Receptionist. The registration receptionist will admit all patients, assist patients' family members, perform reception duties as well as switchboard, scheduling and medical record handling.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Receives patients and family members obtains accurate, complete demographic and insurance information and financial contract / consent on patient charts.
* Ensures patient and their family members’ needs are met regarding their comfort and concerns.
* Participates with surgery scheduler in chart preparation, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality are maintained.
* Obtains appropriate patient/guardian signatures on required forms, verifying accuracy of patient information. Labels forms using established policy and procedure.
* Accurately, and in a timely manner, distributes forms to appropriate areas at time of registration.
* Participates with surgery scheduler in the accurate, proper and appropriate scheduling of cases.
* Receives cash payments from patients and follows corresponding procedure for cash collection.
* Acts as a liaison between clinical units and lobby waiting room.
* Participates in accurate and timely handling of medical records. Copies and mails surgeon's Copies of all transcribed reports.
* Responsible participation in verification of completeness, and filing of all patient medical records.

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or GED
* Minimum of two years related registration/ receptionist/ surgical scheduler experience, preferably in a health care setting.
* Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills to facilitate effective interaction with a variety of health care professionals and the public.
* Ability to work independently and to organize and prioritize work efficiently to achieve Center goals.
* Keyboard skills of 50 wpm minimum.
* Ability to operate computer, various software packages (preferably MS Office), copy machine, fax machine and other office machines.
* Verbal ability required to prepare reports, to take notes/ minutes at meetings, and to compose letters using proper spelling and punctuation.

title: Stock Associate
description:
**Position Overview:**

Drives revenue by providing clients exceptional services through relationship building, sharing style/product information, and presenting a clean, and a safe well-maintained store environment. Consistently achieves individual goals, which support store goals.

**Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:**

* Embraces our values & sets an example through his/her behaviors
* Responsible for compliance with all ANN INC. practices and procedures
* Additional responsibilities as assigned by the Store Manager, Co-Manager, and Sales Leads

**Revenue Generation:**

* Consistently meets or exceeds divisional, store, and individual financial and credit goals while contributing to the store’s overall goals

**Client Experience:**

* Provides excellent client service by anticipating the client’s needs, exceeding expectations, and adhering to ANN INC. service experience standards
* Acknowledges, interacts and builds relationships with clients, creates client loyalty and has the ability to multi-task while servicing internal and external clients
* Addresses client concerns, coming to resolution when possible, and involving management where appropriate
* Portrays a gracious, friendly, energetic and engaging manner and is at all times respectful and professional
* Takes ownership, solicits and incorporates feedback for professional growth and development – Consistently receives positive, unsolicited client feedback
* Communicates effectively with store management, store team, and external clients in person, through written correspondence and over the phone
* Builds collaborative and productive relationships by sharing ideas, treats others fairly, with respect, and values differences
* Embraces our values and behaviors and inspires team by leading by example through his/her words and actions – Supports an environment of learning and trust by acting as a positive role model
* Is responsible for compliance with all Company policies, practices and procedures and all federal, state and local laws

**Operations:**

* Completes opening/closing procedures and tasks as directly by Leadership Team with a client focus (e.g. replenishing merchandise; recovering the store and styling rooms; processing shipment including but not limited to: unpacking, hanging, steaming; cleaning including but not limited to: dusting, vacuuming, and removing trash; executing merchandising moves; marketing updates; and completing prices changes.)
* Meets merchandise processing standards and maintains an organized and accessible work area
* Adheres to Loss Prevention practices and is aware of and reports potential incidents, to ensure shortage control and to protect company assets
* Maintains a safe work environment and reports any potential hazards to store management (e.g., ensuring that exits are unobstructed, ceiling clearance in stockroom is enforced, rugs are not frayed, spills are cleaned up immediately, etc.)
* Participates and assists in the preparation for the stores’ inventory
* Reports to work as scheduled; records time worked accurately by using ANN INC.’s Time and Attendance system; remains flexible to the needs of the business
* Follows all ANN INC. operational guidelines, processes, and procedures
* Reviews Bulletin Boards daily

**Technical Expertise:**

* Demonstrates a desire and ability to be learner responsible and navigates the ANN INC. computer learning systems
* Performs register transactions quickly and efficiently (e.g., sales, send sales, returns, exchanges, payments)
* Is proficient in using Distributed Order Maintenance (DOM’s) and StyleFinder to locate product for clients and processes transactions accurately
* Operates phone, answering calls with an appropriate greeting, transferring and placing calls on hold
* Operates and understand the functions of the PDT

**Product/Brand Management:**

* Understands and can clearly articulate the Company’s brand positioning, including: the uniqueness of all expressions of ANN INC., current marketing and promotional initiatives, markdowns, POS events, Bounce Back promotions, coupon events, lifestyle concepts to internal and external clients
* Lives the ANN INC. Purpose, Values & Behaviors, Practices in all interactions
* Participates in and attends Store Meetings
* Proactively uses associate education tools to build product and styling knowledge with his/her peers
* Embraces fashion, understands current market trends and is able to articulate them using ANN INC. interpretations in every client interaction. Represents the brand by adhering to ANN INC.’s dress code guidelines
* Packages and wraps client purchases according to ANN INC. standards

**Position Requirements:**

* Client Service: Ability to function as a role model, ensuring that the client remains the top priority. Takes initiative to build a loyal client base

title: TECHNICIAN 1st & 2nd Shift
description:
* Performs the assembly/subassembly and final assembly of product.
* Sets up and performs tests according to written procedures, records the resulting data and product performance.
* Assembles products from blueprints or schematics. Largely repetitive work involving fitting and aligning of parts and mechanisms to required tolerance and operating requirements.
* Assembles test set ups and performs testing in accordance with schematics provided by a Test Engineer, Supervisor or standard procedures. Government or customer representative may witness Work.
* Performs more difficult machining operations including drilling, tapping and lathe turning for matching part operation.
* Uses assembly fixtures, bench type power tools, soldering equipment, and inspection devices, as required.
* Performs soldering of components according to set Company procedures.
* Employs prescribed assembly methods and procedures.
* Makes measurements with micrometers, depth micrometers, comparators and shadowgraphs to check part details.
* Works with gasses and hydraulic fluids at various pressures.
* Follows written or verbal instructions on how to perform electrical and mechanical tests.
* Disassembles, repairs or reworks product as required to generate a working unit.

**Skills/Requirements**

* Minimum three years’ mechanical assembly with a working knowledge of assembly blueprints.
* Must have the ability to follow written or verbal instructions on how to perform electrical and mechanical tests.

title: Ambulance Remount and Electrical Technician
description:
**Job Overview**  
Do you love working on many types of vehicles?

Do you get excited for a good challenge and enjoy learning new thing?

Do you have a need for speed?

Do you enjoy working in a clean and organized shop?

Do you admit when you make mistakes or need help?

We have the perfect job for you!

Here at Code 1 Solutions, we upfit emergency vehicles and no two jobs are the same. Our company mission is to build the most efficient and streamlined system for upfitting these vehicles. We are looking for smart and innovative team players who enjoy solving complex problems in order to help us accomplish our mission.

**Advantages of working with Code 1 Solutions:**

* **Full coverage** health insurance, dental and vision.
* Clean shop, all tools provided (best tools). No need to bring your own tools.
* Light and clean mechanical work. No heavy lifting, no dirty work. Mainly panels, wiring & mounting equipment.
* We pride ourselves in having a collaborative team.
* A great job if you want to sharpen your electrical knowledge. Keeps your brain sharp!
* A great opportunity to learn how to service many different makes and models (see models below).

We are seeking a qualified **Ambulance Remount** and Electrical Technician to perform **electrical work and remount services on ambulances and emergency vehicles**. The ideal candidate will have experience in **vehicle electrical systems, installations, troubleshooting, and remounting processes** to ensure that all ambulances are fully operational and meet safety standards.

**Responsibilities**  
- Perform remount services on ambulances, including removal, refurbishment, and reinstallation of electrical systems and components.

- Install, troubleshoot, and repair electrical wiring, lighting, communication systems, and other onboard electrical equipment.

- Diagnose and resolve electrical issues in emergency vehicles, ensuring compliance with safety and industry standards.

- Install custom electrical systems, including lights, sirens, communication devices, and power supply systems.

- Conduct safety checks and inspections to verify the proper functioning of electrical systems before deployment.

- Collaborate with mechanics, fabricators, and other team members to complete remount projects.

- Maintain accurate documentation of work performed, including parts used and system upgrades.

**Qualifications**

* Proven experience as an **Automotive Electrical and Mechanical Technician** or similar role.
* Strong knowledge of **automotive electrical systems, diagnostics, and wiring**, including custom installations (e.g., lighting, communication equipment).
* Experience in **mechanical systems**, including the ability to **remove and reinstall cabs** from vehicles such as taxis, buses, or pickup trucks.
* Proficiency in using **diagnostic tools** such as **Voltmeter, Ohmmeter**, and other electrical troubleshooting tools.
* **Mechanical troubleshooting skills** to diagnose and repair mechanical issues, including suspension, frame, and body components.
* **Familiarity with high voltage** safety protocols and procedures.
* **Experience with large vehicles** (e.g., buses, trucks, or emergency vehicles) is highly desirable.
* Ability to **read and interpret electrical schematics** and wiring diagrams.
* **Experience with custom fabrication** and installation, including light welding or metalwork.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $35.00 - $40.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

* Do you have at least 3 years of experience working on vehicles (maintenance, engine or electric)?

title: Early Childhood Student Support Specialist
description:
This person would be responsible for :

* School Consultations

Children engage in challenging behaviors in their classroom setting. The specialist would be available to observe and consult with the school staff and create an individualized behavior management plan to help support your child’s learning and development.

* Professional Development TrainingsThe consultant would conduct large and small group training on a variety of topics, such as Behavior Management Strategies in the Classroom, Early Childhood Development, and Supporting Children with Special Needs in the Classroom, among other PD’s .
* Family Support Program Workshops

The specialist will host monthly parent workshops, topics will include but not limited to: Toilet Training (Monthly until Jan) How to help your child succeed in Prek (Sept), Social Emotional (Nov), Homework Routine (Jan), Promote Independence (Feb) Understand Child’s behavior (March), Routines/Structure (Pk attendance - April), Avoid Summer Slide - Gr. K Readiness (May)

* Classroom ConsultationThis includes classroom observations and meetings with staff to discuss general teaching strategies to meet the needs of all students and provide action plans for next steps.
* Behavior CoachingThe Specialist is available to work with classroom staff (along with the child’s family) to address the challenging behaviors and/or specific learning needs of individual children in your classroom. They will develop FBAs and BIPs and ensure team implementation.
* Special Education Coordination

This specialist will assist teachers completing the referral process and assist parents with the evaluation process. They will attend and actively participate in the IEP meetings, and provide school leaders notes.

In addition,

* Assist in providing a safe, warm and supportive classroom atmosphere that supports each child’s individual growth and development
* Ensure the safety and well-being of each child by responding to their emotional, social, physical and educational needs
* Be warm and nurturing with children
* Establish a professional level of rapport with each family in order to provide quality care
* Utilize developmentally appropriate practice and best practice methods at all times
* Maintain a professional self-image and project the values of the school at all times Assist in providing a safe, warm and supportive classroom atmosphere that supports each child’s individual growth and development
* Engage in conversation with the students at all parts of the day, centers/meal time/walking breaks/ etc.
* Assist the teacher in observing the skills of individual students, assessing their strengths and the areas that need improvement
* Supervise the class if the teacher needs to step out of the classroom
* Enforce school and classroom rules
* Contribute to the SMORE newsletter weekly
* Provide daily recap summaries and next steps
* Provide small group SEL instruction, based on students’ needs
* Support and assist school staff and students as per school leaders’ directives
* Perform other duties as assigned/needed as per the school leaders’ directives

Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package included.

Position start date: **ASAP**

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 per week

Experience:

* Social work: 1 year (Required)

title: Customer Service/Call Center Part-Time
description:
Are you interested in taking your career to the next step with an industry leader? We have just the opportunity for you! We are a leading home services provider and due to our continued growth we are looking for personable and reliable individuals to serve as Customer Service Representatives. You will handle inbound and outbound customer service calls from an established customer base while answering questions and providing consultation on pricing, service plans and billing issues.

Our focus is on providing exceptional customer care first and foremost. You will be empowered to do what it takes to help each customer. We offer competitive compensation and benefits for full time roles, as well as overtime opportunities during the busy winter season. You may also find room for advancement with us. If this sounds like the kind of career move you have wanted to make and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!

Responsibilities:  
As a Customer Service Representative, you will take incoming calls from our customers and make outbound customer calls for follow-up and upselling purposes. Above all, you will use your communication and active listening skills to provide customers with exceptional service.

Specific duties include:

* Preparing account changes
* Troubleshooting and resolving customer issues
* Identifying and acting upon potential new sales opportunities
* Assisting with customer retention
* Working with other departments to ensure timely resolution of customer issues
* Negotiating customer prices, service plan payments and billing issues consistent with specified company guidelines

Requirements:

As a Customer Service Representative, you must be pleasant and professional with an engaging personality and possess the ability to function equally well both independently and in a team environment. You must be detail oriented and focused, with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal and active listening skills, along with the ability to interact effectively with both customers and coworkers.

Specific qualifications include:

* High School Diploma or Equivalent
* 1-2 years in a customer-facing role; prior experience in a customer service setting preferred
* Ability to work well in a fast paced environment
* Excellent telephone skills
* Strong troubleshooting abilities
* Solid negotiating skills
* Computer proficient
* Must be flexible for weekday and weekend shifts

Benefits:

As a Customer Service Representative, you will be part of an evolving organization that built its reputation on providing our customers with the best possible service. Our employees are one of the main keys to our continued success, therefore, we are committed to your professional development and you may find opportunities for advancement to roles of greater responsibility within our organization.

Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including:

* Medical coverage (F/T staff)
* Dental coverage (F/T staff)
* Retirement Savings
* Plus more!

Build a rewarding career with an industry leader!

Apply now!

The hourly pay rate is $18.50 per hour.

We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.

title: Medical Assistant(Clinical) (Monday to Friday) (Day Shift) - Brooklyn,NY
description:
AdvantageCare Physicians (ACPNY) is a primary and specialty care practice serving half a million patients across the New York metropolitan area. With more than 35 medical offices across New York City and Long Island, ACPNY is continually expanding our practice and enhancing our services for communities throughout New York. As we grow, our employees grow with us.

We’re bringing together an amazing Care Team to work with our patients in Staten Island. As a member of this team, you would help us in delivering “whole you” care, which recognizes the physical, mental, and lifestyle factors that impact a patient’s health.

We are proud that our workforce is as diverse as the communities we serve, and we are intentional about our inclusive practices for our organization. This commitment drives our unyielding desire to deliver high-quality care and community-focused collaborations. By integrating these behaviors into our day-to-day operations, ACPNY strives to create healthier futures for our patients.

To do this, we need an exceptional group of physicians, nurses, and support staff.

**Job Summary**

We are seeking Medical Assistants (Care Team Associates II) to join us

**The ideal candidate should have:**

* Work experience as a Medical Assistant
* Patient-centered approach toward a positive patient experience
* Excellent communication skills

**Responsibilities:**

Medical Assistant (Care Team Associate II) serves as a member of the Care Team in the treatment and care of patients who assists providers with clinical services and administrative tasks to support population health guided best in class care. The position works under the supervision of the Practice Administrator and in collaboration with the Nurse Manager. The Medical Assistant (Care Team Associate II) must understand basic medical terminology, demonstrate customer service excellence, have the ability to recognize data reflective of the patient’s status and inform the Registered Nurse/Licensed Practical Nurse of his/her observations.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or GED required
* Certificate of completion from an accredited Medical Assistant Program required **or** eligibility to sit for the national certification exam and pass the exam within 18 months of hire required
* Minimum 1 year experience as medical assistant in an ambulatory care setting
* Experience and ability to navigate an EMR required
* Associate degree preferred
* Preferred 3 years’ experience as medical assistant in an ambulatory care setting preferred

**Medical Office Hours of Operation**

* Monday-Thursday 8:00AM – 6:00PM
* Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**Why work at AdvantageCare Physicians?**

ACPNY’s vision is to become a home for health that provides personal, effective, and convenient care for the neighborhoods and communities we serve. When our teams of providers, nurses, and specialists work together, we can get patients in sooner, answer their questions in real time, and give them the support they need to achieve their health goals. Everything we do is guided by our values:

**Empower** — We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.

**Deliver** — We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.

**Do It Together** — We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Encouraging growth and development is an important part of the employee experience at ACPNY. We empower employees to develop both personally and professionally through a variety of programs, including internal collaborative learning opportunities where team members share stories from their own lives, discuss research, and ultimately learn from each other.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to creating a strong workplace and community.

**Pay Disclosure:**

A good faith estimate of the compensation range for individuals hired to work for the EmblemHealth Family of Companies is provided. This compensation range is specific and considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, internal peer equity, and market and business considerations. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the work is being performed. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range, as compensation decisions depend on each case’s facts and circumstances. Union roles covered by a collective bargaining agreement will compensate in accordance with the union contract.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.44 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Internal Medicine

* Primary Care

title: Andrology Lab Technician
description:
This role involves handling, analyzing, and preparing sperm samples and assisting with clerical work in an endocrinology/embryology lab

NYC IVF if a boutique fertility clinic in midtown Manhattan with an in-house lab and OR. We specialized in personalized care for our patients. The Andrology Lab Technician works in fertility clinics and laboratories, supporting fertility treatments. We are looking for a candidate with start dates as soon as possible.

Key Responsibilities:

Sperm Analysis and Processing:

* Perform semen analysis, including sperm count, motility, and morphology.
* Process and prepare sperm samples for IVF or intrauterine insemination (IUI).
* Conduct cryopreservation (freezing) of sperm samples for future use

Immunoassay/Endocrinology Machine

* Prepare the machine and ensure that it is properly set up for operation.
* Regularly calibrate the machine to maintain accurate results.
* Prepare and handling of biological samples – verification, labeling, prepare samples for loading, resulting, and further handling as needed.

Laboratory Maintenance and Compliance:

* Perform daily quality assurance for all equipment.
* Follow strict protocols and regulations to ensure safety, cleanliness, and quality control.
* Keep accurate records of all procedures, patient samples, and results.
* Ensure compliance with all legal and ethical guidelines related to fertility treatments.

Patient and Team Support:

* Collaborate with physicians, nurses, and other laboratory staff to ensure seamless
* fertility treatment processes.
* Communicate lab results and information to medical staff in a clear and timely manner.
* Provide support to patients undergoing fertility treatments with empathy and
* professionalism.

Qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in biology, biotechnology, or a related field. Certification in Clinical Andrology is an advantage.
* Experience in andrology, particularly in a fertility clinic or IVF laboratory for minimum of one year.
* Knowledge of sperm cryopreservation techniques.
* Familiarity with laboratory best practices, equipment handling, and quality control.

Skills:

* Strong attention to detail and precision in laboratory tasks.
* Ability to work under pressure, especially during time-sensitive procedures.
* Excellent communication skills and teamwork.
* Empathy and sensitivity when working with patients undergoing fertility treatments.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 - $55,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Ob/Gyn

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Fertility & andrology care: 1 year (Required)

License/Certification:

* Andrology Certification (Required)

title: Regional Outside Sales Manager
description:
Sales Managers-- are you interested in taking your next career step with an industry leader? We have just the opportunity for you. You will be responsible for talent acquisition, developing local marketing campaigns, develop sales objectives, etc.

We are looking for a sales leader with a competitive spirit and a passion for success to assume the role of Regional Sales Manager for an industry leader.

Your specific duties will include:

* Instill and maintain a goal oriented attitude for the sales team.
* Lead a team of sales professionals to achieve targeted goals.
* Develop, train, and acquire talented sales professionals.
* Manage all regionally related customer acquisition and equipment sales activities.
* Develop and implement detailed annual sales plans incorporating competitive intelligence and account profitability.
* Develop and implement local advertising and marketing campaigns to drive new account acquisition.
* Implement a plan to grow market share through relationship building which will translate into incremental lead activity.
* Work in conjunction with the local General Manager to achieve District Goals.
* Oversee performance management initiatives, competency-based assessments using performance metrics, and job function analysis.

**Requirements:** As a Regional Sales Manager, you must be pleasant, professional and possess the ability to function equally well in both a team environment and independently. You must also be highly detail-oriented and focused with a flexible and adaptable nature. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication, interpersonal, and active listening skills as well as the ability to interact effectively with both customer and co-workers.

Specific qualifications in this role will include:

* Has a successful track record working with sales organizations to achieve and exceed their sales goals.
* Track record of attaining challenging sales goals and managing accounts within a designated region. Must have used territory analysis to effectively target high potential market areas.
* Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships across functional organizational areas.
* Expects excellence from others and tolerates no less. Inspires people to accomplish the extraordinary.
* Successfully achieves positive, concrete results through hard work and perseverance.
* Develops sales strategies, techniques, and tactics based on customer feedback and market environment.
* Demonstrated ability to work with technology. Well versed in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

***We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and are committed to a drug and alcohol-free workplace.***

**The base salary range for this role is $90k commensurate on experience, with the potential to additionally earn generous commissions and bonuses.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 per year

* Vision insurance

* 8 hour shift

title: Production Team Partner - Linen Bagger & Folder - UniFirst
description:
Our Production Team is Kind of a Big Deal!
  
UniFirst is seeking a reliable and hardworking Production Team Partner to join our UniFirst Family. As a Team Partner in the Production Department, you will be working as a team to ensure customer garments are always in exceptional condition through quality inspection. At UniFirst we have a 5-day work week, enjoy Saturday and Sunday off!! We have an immediate opening and provide on the job training. Pay & Benefits:
  
On the job training & great hourly pay + 401K with Company Match, Profit Sharing, Health Insurance, Employee Assistance Program, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, Direct Payroll Deposit, Tuition Reimbursement, 30% Employee Discount, Employee Referral Bonuses.
  
  

What’s in it for you?
  
  

**Training:**  

Our Team Partners receive ongoing cross-training, exposing them to different areas of production. Cross training enhances their performance and assists them with their career potential and advancement.
  
  

**Work Life Balance:**  

We offer a 40-hour work week. Enjoy weekends off!
  
  

**Career Growth:**  

Some companies like to promote from within, we love to! Many of our managers started at UniFirst working on the production floor!
  
  

**Culture:**  

Our family culture is what makes UniFirst an organization that stands out from the rest.
  
  

**Diversity:**  

At UniFirst, you'll find an environment packed with different cultures, personalities, and backgrounds. We believe our diversity makes us who we are, and we strive every day to build a culture where everyone feels welcome. What you’ll be doing:
  
Fold cloths, towels, and wipers
  
Bundle, package, and bag articles in accordance with company requirements
  
Inspect products for holes, tears, stains, and damage.
  
Follow all safety policies, HACCP and medical guidelines
  
Perform other duties as described by area supervisor or management
  
Qualifications
  
  

**What we’re looking for:**  

High school education and/or GED equivalent preferred
  
Must be at least 18 years of age or older
  
Ability to stand for 8-hour shift
  
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  
Ability to read, write, and communicate clearly with management
  
Ability to perform basic mathematical operations using American standard units of weight measurement, volume, and distance About UniFirst
  
The fabric of UniFirst is woven from its very unique family culture where our Team Partners enjoy a small company feel while taking advantage of the resources and stability that come with being a 2 billion-dollar organization.
  
UniFirst is an international leader in the $18 billion-dollar garment services industry. We currently employ over 14,000 team partners who serve 300,000 business customer locations throughout the U.S., Canada, and Europe. We were included in the top 10 of Selling Power magazine’s “Best Companies to Sell For” list and recognized on Forbes magazine’s “Platinum 400 – Best Big Companies” list. As an 80-year old company focused on annual growth, there’s never been a better time to join our team.
  
  

UniFirst is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or employment against any individual on the basis of race, color, gender, national origin, ancestry, religion, physical or mental disability, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy, citizenship, or any other factor protected by anti-discrimination laws.

title: Provider Specialist: Family Child Care Programs
description:
Norwescap Child and Family Resources (CFRS) is seeking a Provider Specialist. Norwescap CFRS is the designated Child Care Resource and Referral Agency for Hunterdon, Sussex and Warren Counties, by the NJ Department of Human Services, Division of Family Development (DFD). Our mission is to empower families and the community through enhancing the quality and accessibility of early education and by providing information and resources to community services.

The Provider Specialist is responsible for ensuring effective operations in all aspects of the Family Child Care (FCC) registration program and the Family, Friend and Neighbor (FFN) program as defined by the contract with Department of Health, Division of Family Development and Office of Licensing, and Norwescap policies and procedures. This includes supporting potential providers from intake to application, training, inspection, and reporting, as well as other duties assigned by the Provider Manager or other management team.

* Maintain all records for Family Child Care (FCC) and Family Friend and Neighbor (FFN) providers
* Ensure that each FCC provider operates in full compliance with all applicable requirements of the Manual of Requirements and DFD regulations
* Ensure that each FFN provider operates in full compliance with DFD regulations
* Conduct Outreach to attract potential FCC providers.
* Facilitate monthly orientations for potential FCC and FFN providers. Develop and present Peer Group and other professional development/training to FCC providers.
* Provide Technical Assistance to help Potential Providers through the application process and throughout their registration period.
* Utilize systems including NJCCIS and Expedite, schedule, and conduct timely home inspections for new or renewing providers, as well as yearly monitor inspections.
* Receive, process, and follow through on FCC complaints.
* Communicate with the provider Program Manager regularly to share information to enhance tasks and team functions.
* Facilitate providers’ understanding of the EPPIC program.
* Track providers’ CPR/1st Aid expirations and background checks
* Complete program reports
* Attend State and local meetings as required
* Utilize effective communication and active listening in a communication mode that best meets the needs of customers.
* Adhere to strict confidentiality procedures
* Utilize the assessment process to ascertain needs of families and provide appropriate resources and referrals
* Adhere to the Agency’s Personnel Policies and Procedures.
* Performs other related duties as required by the CFRS Director.
* Collaborate with Child, Adult Care Food Program (CACFP) staff to facilitate site visits to ensure compliance with CACFP program and provide technical assistance to enhance program.
* Bilingual in English and Spanish strongly encouraged to apply.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $21.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Early Childhood General Education Teachers: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: KFC Team Member
description:
At KFC, we feed the world. But we do more than fill people up. We fulfill their life. Our meals matter, and when we serve them with southern hospitality, we make our customer's day. So our jobs are more than a paycheck - they're about being independent, having fun, and making new friends.  

  

As a Team Member, you could be the smiling face that greets and serves customers. Or you could be the cook that prepares our world famous chicken (and tell your friends you know the "secret" - just kiddin'). Whatever job you do, you know what you do matters - to your team and to your customers.  

  

**Requirements:**  

  

The good news is that your training will teach you everything you need to know to succeed on the job. But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:  

  

* You're a fun and friendly person who values customers and takes absolute pride in everything you do.


- You like talking - a lot - even to strangers (despite what your Mom told you). This is important, because you're not able to text message customers.
  

- You've got attitude - the right kind of course - and understand the need to be on time, all the time. With loads of energy, you understand that work is easier - and more fun - working as a team.  

* And you're at least 16 years old.

  

Keep in mind, this is just basic information. You'll find out more after you apply. And independently-owned franchised or licensed locations may have different requirements.  

  

**Additional Info:**  

  

This job posting is for a position in a restaurant that is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. This means your application will be reviewed by the franchisee who will make any hiring decisions. If hired, the franchisee will be your employer and is alone responsible for any employment related matters.  

  

We've got great jobs for people just starting their careers, looking for a flexible second job or continuing to work after retirement. If you want a fun, flexible job and be part of a winning team, find out now why Life Tastes Better with KFC. Apply today!
company_description: Colonel Harland David Sanders was an businessman, best known for founding fast food chicken restaurant chain KFC and later acting as the company's brand ambassador & symbols of the company.

title: KFC General Manager
description:
At KFC, we feed the world. But we do more than fill people up. We fulfill their life. Our meals matter, and when we serve them with southern hospitality, we make our customer's day. So our jobs are more than a paycheck - they're about being independent, having fun, and making new friends.
  

  

If you're already a successful manager, you need to check out our Restaurant General Manager position. As a Restaurant General Manager, you have the keys to a $1 million+ business (literally!). And when you grow your team and the business by making our customers' day, you get rewarded in a big way.  

  

**Requirements:**  

  

The good news is that your training will teach you everything you need to know to succeed on the job. But there are a few skills you should have from the get-go:  

  

* A natural leader, you want to be co-captain because you can help bring together a winning team. You're all about creating a great place to work for the team.
* You want to make your customer's day and it shows in the way you are maniacal about serving great-tasting chicken with a great big smile.


- We have a GREAT culture and look for GREAT people to add to our family. You know who you are -honest, energetic, motivational and fun.  

* You set high standards for yourself and for the team.
* You're up for a challenge. You love the excitement of the restaurant business and know every day is different.


- And, you're at least 18 years old with a valid driver's license, reliable transportation (not public transportation - you may need to drive to make deposits for the restaurant sometimes) and a true desire to learn and grow.  

  

**Additional Info:**  

  

This job posting is for a position in a restaurant that is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. This means your application will be reviewed by the franchisee who will make any hiring decisions. If hired, the franchisee will be your employer and is alone responsible for any employment related matters.

title: Sales Associate - 24H150
description:
Sales Associate - 24H150

**Employee Type:**


Regular### **If you are a CURRENT Carter’s employee, you MUST apply through the Internal Career Link within the My Career & Performanceapp in . Do not apply using the below external application.**

**Carter’s, Inc. is the largest branded marketer in North America of apparel exclusively for babies and young children. The Company owns the Carter’s and OshKosh B’gosh brands, two of the most recognized brands in the marketplace. These brands are sold in leading department stores, national chains, and specialty retailers domestically and internationally. They are also sold through more than 1,000 Company-operated stores in the United States, Canada, and Mexico and online at www.carters.com, www.oshkosh.com, www.cartersoshkosh.ca, and www.carters.com.mx. The Company’s Child of Mine brand is available at Walmart, its Just One You brand is available at Target, and its Simple Joys brand is available on Amazon. The Company also owns Skip Hop, a global lifestyle brand for families with young children. Carter’s is headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia. Additional information may be found at www.carters.com.**

**Baby Clothing, Kids Clothes, Toddler Clothes | Carter's**

**Shop for baby clothing, baby necessities and essentials at Carters.com, the most trusted name in baby, kids, and toddler clothing. Shop our selection of cute baby & kids clothing.**

**POSITION PURPOSE**


The Sales Associate (SA) is responsible for interacting with customers and employees to create a positive store environment. The SA maximizes sales by ensuring a neat, clean, and organized store. Responsible for the execution of operational activities and protecting Company assets through exceptional customer service. The SA is responsible for providing information regarding product benefits and ensuring that customers are satisfied with their experience.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTION (TASKS, DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITES MOST IMPORTANT)**

**Customer Focus:**

* Confidently and proactively helps resolve issues for customers and can balance a number of customers in a busy retail environment.
* Meets customer’s needs by assisting with locating merchandise, informing customers of promotions and revisiting frequently to ensure a positive shopping experience.
* Expedites point of sale transactions at the time of the sale.
* Completes floor replenishment and shipment as needed to ensure customer satisfaction and size availability.

**Brand Execution:**

* Ensures store visual standards are set to company direction.
* Executes replenishment process, recovers, and cleans the sales floor to company standard.
* Completes merchandise floor sets according to visual standards and directives.
* Maintains solid product knowledge and merchandise presentation.
* Articulates current promotional events and the brand loyalty program with the customer.

**Drive Growth:**

* Minimizes store loss by providing exceptional customer service.
* Maintains housekeeping standards to ensure a positive experience for customers and team.
* Meets or exceeds company productivity standards for all operational processes.
* Achieves daily goals as established by management.

**Team Development:**

* Establishes and maintains a cooperative working relationship with all members of the team.
* Adapts performing assignments as requested.
* Supports management direction of store.
* Supports, trains, and coaches others to success.
* Adheres to all company policies and safety procedures as directed by the company.

**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES**

* Demonstrated customer engagement skills.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
* High school diploma or GED preferred.
* Ability to communicate effectively with customers and employees.
* Retail/specialty apparel knowledge and experience preferred.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* Ability to lift 40 pounds on a regular basis.
* Ability to stand for long periods of time; climb up and down a ladder.
* Constant walking and standing; frequent bending, stooping and reaching.

**AVAILABILITY REQUIREMENTS**

* Availability to meet the needs of the business that may include days, nights, weekends and holidays as scheduled.
* Any availability changes must be approved by the Store Manager and will be approved based on business needs.
* Scheduled working shifts from 3-8 hours in length (applicable state laws apply).
* Minimum number of hours is not guaranteed.

**NOTE:**This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The duties described may be changed or reassigned at the discretion of management, and the employee may be required to perform duties that are not listed in the job description.


Compensation for this position ranges from $16.00 - $18.25 per hour based on experience and location.


Carters is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. #### **Purpose**


The purpose of the Manager I (MGRI) position is to assist Branch management in tactically executing QSR or similar restaurant management operations. The MGRI ensures the restaurant is clean, ready for business, staffed, and operates to high operational standards. The MGRI uses prescribed policies and procedures to make management decisions.


#### **Essential Functions**

* Completes opening, daily and closing procedures/checklists in accordance with company policies/procedures
* Assists the AGM/GM in managing by supervising day-to-day activities of associates within a defined individual or group of restaurants or points-of-sale
* Participates in the interview process, provides input in hiring, recommends termination, advancement, promotion or any other status change to the GM for associates within the unit
* Assigns work tasks and activities, participates in preparing schedules, and ensures that all shifts are covered
* Actively ensures all associates take all mandated rest breaks and meal periods
* Ensures display areas are appropriately clean, stocked, and visually appealing
* Ensures all equipment is in good working order
* Operates cash register and voids transactions as needed while following all HMSHost cash handling policies and procedures, and maintains proper security of cash at all times
